reasoning: Radiation-induced angiosarcoma (RIAS) is a rare secondary malignancy following radiotherapy, most commonly after breast cancer treatment. Occurs in 0.05-0.3% of breast cancer patients receiving breast-conserving surgery and adjuvant radiotherapy. Conservative global estimate of 0.05 per 100,000 based on cumulative incidence studies. Median latency period is 6 years (range 3-12 years).
source: Pitson G et al. (2005). Radiation-associated sarcoma after breast cancer. Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys. 62(2):307-315
